author: Em Day Hall

comments.message: Hi Em, interesting idea. Can you give us some sample content that you might use to express these messages? Perhaps have a go at writing some lyrics and update your post so the community can help you build these lyrics? Music has a huge potential to help boost community morale as well as educate on safe practices. What specific channels would you use to spread this content in West Africa - radio stations, public spaces etc? Looking forward to see you grow this idea! Good luck.

description: Music is a powerful communication tool that has been a shaping force in West African society and politics. There are already songs being played on the radios in West Africa helping to stop the spread of Ebola. Perhaps a song could also help turn the public perception of surivors from one of fear to one of hope.
summary: Survivors of Ebola are being ostracized, but they are needed to provide the base material for life saving serums, their blood. A survivor may be encouraged to conceal their status and not come forward  to avoid being displaced by a fearful community. We should encourage songwriters and musicians to make music depicting survivors who donate blood to cure others as heros. Use the music as a recruiting tool to encourage survivors to help in any way they can especially by donating blood to support treatment and create more survivors.
title: Recruit survivors through song
